page.title: 05CHURCHES
page.content: There are seven churches in our Domesday Block. There are{Parish Churches at Stow, Upper and Lower Swell which are all{very old.}Stow's Church Tower is a landmark for miles around and there are 110 steps to the top. The peal of eight bells is the heaviest in Gloucestershire. There are usually about 40/50 people on a Sunday morning. The next oldest church is the{Baptist Chapel. The present building is is 143 years old but there has been a Baptist Church meeting for over 300 years. The Sunday congregation is about 60. The {Roman Catholic Church}uses a former school building and over 100 people meet for worship. There is a{Methodist Church and a{Brethren}Meeting Room.
